inclusion.criterion: fibroids, endometriosis, abnormal bleeding, uterine prolapse and intra-epithelial neoplasia of the cervix grade 3
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: hysterectomy is the most common major gynecological operation performed; in previous study, 20% of women will have undergone a hysterectomy by the age of 50 years, mostly for nonmalignant conditions such as uterine fibroids, endometriosis, abnormal bleeding, uterine prolapse and intra-epithelial neoplasia of the cervix grade 3
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Fever is the most common perioperative complication of hysterectomy, arising in about 25%
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: If they experienced pelvic reconstructive surgery for pelvic organ prolapse or stress urinary incontinence
exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma of the spine complicated by severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention s/p Foley catheter

exclusion.criterion: If they have bacteriuria and clinical urinary tract symptoms, e.g. dysuria, frequency, urgency and stress incontinence before surgery
exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Patient has urinary retention and may have other urinary tract symptoms

notes: The patient's history of anaplastic astrocytoma and urinary retention suggests that they may not be eligible for this trial due to exclusion criteria related to pelvic reconstructive surgery and bacteriuria with clinical urinary tract symptoms.
